name: African Storybook
description: Provides open access to picture storybooks in the languages of Africa for children’s literacy, enjoyment and imagination.

sdgs.relevance:
The African Storybook webpage itself (https://www.africanstorybook.org) demonstrates that the 4269 storybooks and the 8098 translations in 242 languages are relevant to the Quality Education SDG. 
There are also reviews and descriptions of African Storybook at:
https://www.alllanguageresources.com/african-storybook/
https://allafrica.com/stories/202202110011.html - this review stresses the importance of quality storybooks in indigenous languages which is one of the features of ASb
https://oep.merlot.org/docs/african-storybook.pdf


A published research article on ASb can be found here: https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/modl.12374

The Scale of Solution details indicate all of the educational organisations that ASb works with

Judith Uchidiuno has also reviewed several of the books on her Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/people/African-Storybook-Reviews-Judith-Uchidiuno/100055884440164/

Standard LAMP implementation
Content: at https://www.africanstorybook.org on the top right hand corner of the READ page there is a HELP menu that contains "how to" guides for how to use the website, reading levels, searching storybooks as well as in depth guides on 
- Developing and translating African Storybooks
- Preparing to use and using storybooks with children
- Translation
There is also an ASb YouTube channel with numerous guides (https://www.youtube.com/user/africanstorybookorg)
